definitions.definition: To adapt to; to learn, grasp or master.
definitions.example: Although he had never skated before, he took to it quickly, and soon glided around the ice with ease.

definitions.definition: To enter; to go into or move towards.
definitions.example: As the train rushed through, thousands of birds took to the air at once.

definitions.definition: To begin, as a new habit or practice.
definitions.example: After the third one was rejected, she took to asking the department to check the form before she submitted it.
